when:
Thursday 10th July 2025 Sponsors' Evening
Friday 11th July 2025 6pm - 11pm
Saturday 12th July 2025 Noon - 11pm
howmuch:
£6 door entry (includes glass)
Tokens are £2 each
1 token for a half pint of beer/cider
2 tokens for a pint of beer/cider
2 tokens for a single gin
4 tokens for a double gin
Soft Drinks are FREE

location.address: Lymm Village Hall, Pepper Street, Lymm, WA13 0JB

food: Food will be available to purchase

brews.name: Milson
brews.description: New England pale ale brewed with Citra, Galaxy & Mosaic. Built on an oaty body for a satisfying gulp, full of tropical fruitiness from a high dry hop.

brews.name: To The Trees
brews.description: Modern hazy pale. First ever use of Manilita hops, Brand new experimental hop. Notes of Red Grapefruit, Tangerine, White Grape and Pepper.

brews.name: Castle Hill
brews.description: Session pale ale, with aromas of grapefruit and tropical fruits

brews.name: Chocolate Cherry Mild
brews.description: Dark chocolate, coffee and liquorice flavours of a dark mild, with a dry bitter-sweet cherry flavour.

brews.name: Precipice Trail
brews.description: Rounded and flavourful with a soft full mouthfeel. Holding flavours of citrus and tropical fruits, with a light herbal note wrapping it all together.

brews.name: Kalidasa
brews.description: Our Mango Pale boasts a perfectly balanced profile. The subtle bitterness of premium hops harmonises beautifully with the succulent mango flavours creating a refreshing, fruit-forward brew that's perfect for any occasion.

brews.name: Sonoma
brews.description: Sonoma encapsulates what we love at Track. A refreshing, sessionable, hazy pale ale to be shared, which shows our love for hops & the pursuit of pale perfection. With a simple malt base & hopped generously with Mosaic, Centennial & Citra it bursts forth with resinous notes of sticky mandarin and grapefruit. It finishes crisp & clean with a soft, pithy bitterness

brews.name: Beach House
brews.description: Pale Ale brewed with Motueka, Mosaic & Simcoe

brews.name: No Hay Banda
brews.description: Hoppy West Coast Pale with Cryo Mosiac, Citra and Mosaic.

brews.name: Creme Bearlee
brews.description: Dessert lovers, sit up and sup up. This luscious, dark, and sweet stout immediately garnered attention from both stout lovers and sceptics. Roasty, toasty notes from dark malts combined with the sweetness of molasses and Madagascan vanilla make this the perfect “entry-level” stout for those wishing to venture unknowingly onto the dark side. Once converted, Crème Bearlee will welcome you time and again into its deliciously sweet embrace

brews.name: Strong Dark Mild
brews.description: crafted with Maris Otter, premium crystal and chocolate malts, and West African fonio, an ancient grain that contributes creaminess and subtle fruit character. Dark brewing sugars further enhance the beer with complex layers of caramel and richness.

brews.name: Pink Grapefruit Jaipur
brews.description: Our flagship IPA, Jaipur, already brings a vibrant grapefruit character from its six-hop blend, but we wanted to take that citrus intensity a step further. By adding pink grapefruit, we’re amplifying the fresh, zesty profile to create an even bolder experience. This enhancement brings a new layer of bright, tangy sweetness that perfectly complements the beer’s natural hop bitterness, resulting in a refreshingly balanced and fruit-forward IPA that is bursting with character.

brews.name: New England Pale Ale
brews.description: A sessionable beer packed with all the flavour of a modern classic. A full and fluffy mouthfeel assisted by the presence of malted oats, combined with a progressive, well considered dry hop. Expect hits of pineapple and coconut from the Sabro hops, and a clean finish from our American yeast strain.

brews.name: Pen To Paper
brews.description: A delicious modern pale featuring Emperor, Vic Secret, Citra and Chinook. Gentle pine and tropical notes.

brews.name: Feedback Inbound
brews.description: Classic DEYA cask formula using a new hop variety called Möst. (Strawberry bubblegum meets citrus and tropical fruit.)

brews.name: Session
brews.description: All-day drinker Session IPA. Session by name, session by nature.

brews.name: Black
brews.description: ShinDigger BLACK. A foamy dome crown, fit for a King. || MADE IN MANCHESTER || There’s more than one black liquid in town

brews.name: Ossett Blonde
brews.description: Full-bodied, well-rounded and slightly sweet on the palate. A generous addition of Mount Hood hops late in the boil result in a delicate fruity aroma.

brews.name: Otters' Pool
brews.description: Thirst Quenching English Hopped Pale Ale

brews.name: Sir Philip
brews.description: An original premium bitter.

brews.name: Tarquell
brews.description: Classic pale/gold Mancunian bitter.

brews.name: Lust for Life
brews.description: Double dry hopped with Citra, Simcoe, Mosaic. Packed with a ripe, juicy character of mango, peach and pine.

brews.name: Neapolitan Single Scoop
brews.description: Strawberry, Chocolate & Vanilla Ice Cream SourOur favourite flavours of ice cream are the inspiration for our latest dessert sours, back again in a series of single, double, and triple scoops… Sweet strawberries, rich chocolate, and smooth vanilla combine into a single (but generous) scoop of soft ice cream for a vibrant, fruity flavour and a smooth, luscious mouthfeel.

brews.name: OGB
brews.description: The true original ginger beer. Based on the traditional recipe founded in Yorkshire in the 1700’s, brewed and fermented with a traditional recipe using only fresh ingredients. It doesn’t get more authentic than this. A drink steeped in History.

brews.name: Pilsner
brews.description: The juice is loose! Squeeze The Day is our latest special, combining the creamy characteristics of wheat beer with a zesty orange burst. Plenty of citrus aromas meet with subtle spices from cracked coriander seeds. Smooth and crisp with a zesty and sweet tang, balanced with a gentle hop bitterness. This fruity number is not one to be missed.

about:
The Lymm Beer Festival was the brainchild of the Lymm and District Round Table member Chris Stephens. Started in 2011, the Lymm Beer Fest has quickly established itself as a firm favourite with local people and has become one of the three main annual charity events organised by Lymm and District Round Table in order to raise money for local charities and community groups. The other events are the Lymm Charity Duck Race and the Big Lymm Fireworks.

The event will take place in the Lymm Village Hall and will offer many carefully selected real ales, ciders and perries. Lymm Ladies will also be serving a fantastic selection of gins. There will be live music involving a host of talented local bands and singers, and a selection of food to purchase, with all profits going to charity. For those abstaining or driving we will also be offering free soft drinks.
